description: Predictive coding instrumentation gap — measuring whether the swarm enforces Expect-act-diff or merely documents it
hypothesis: Enforcement of >=1 explicit Expect: statement per session will raise challenge rate above the S179-S181 baseline of ~1/100+ sessions. Without enforcement, predictive coding remains latent.
expect: After 4+ S300+ sessions with CORE.md principle 11 (expect-before-acting), at least 2/4 sessions will show logged Expect: entries in SESSION-LOG or NEXT.md. Challenge rate should be >1%.

actual.notes: SESSION-LOG only runs to S191/S195/S301/S306 (sparse). NEXT.md has 62 'expect' mentions but zero formatted as 'Expect:' protocol lines. CORE.md principle 11 added at v0.6 (S178). Protocol is documented; automated injection is absent.

diff.gap: Challenge rate remains near-zero post-principle-11 addition. Principle 11 documents the behavior but does not enforce it. Agents follow the protocol inconsistently — documented in the session as intent but not as formatted evidence.
diff.key_finding: Predictive coding is still LATENT after principle addition. Protocol enforcement requires spawn-time injection of 'Expect:' field as structured field in lane rows, not prose documentation.
diff.quantified_gap: 0/4 sessions show logged Expect: in SESSION-LOG. Principle 11 adoption rate: ~0% for S300-S307 based on observable artifacts.

iso_isomorphism.finding: Predictive coding in brains fires prediction-error signals automatically — there is no voluntary compliance step. The swarm equivalent requires voluntary compliance, which fails at scale.
iso_isomorphism.swarm_implication: Enforcement must be structural (spawn-time field injection) not normative (principle text). Analogy: the brain does not 'decide' to emit prediction errors; the architecture guarantees it.

next_action.recommendation: Add 'expect=' as a required field in new SWARM-LANES rows at spawn time. orient.py should warn if current session has zero Expect: entries after first commit. Target: >=80% of sessions log at least one expectation.
next_action.metric: Session-level expect-entry rate. Goal: >50% in 10 sessions post-enforcement.
next_action.priority: HIGH — F-BRN2 is the highest-ROI brain frontier; auto-injection is the missing piece.

swarm_facing_extraction.text: Normative protocols (write in a principle file) fail at scale; structural protocols (enforce at spawn/commit time) are required for >80% compliance. Any behavior the swarm must exhibit consistently must be wired into tooling, not documentation.

status: PARTIAL — baseline confirmed: predictive coding enforcement rate is 0% post-principle-11. Structural enforcement path identified. F-BRN2 remains OPEN pending auto-injection implementation.
